message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: public Iterator<Entry<String, String>> iterator() {
    List<Entry<String, String>> entries = new ArrayList<>();
    for (Map.Entry<String, Map<String, String>> centralEntry : centralMap.entrySet()) {
        String centralKey = centralEntry.getKey();
        Map<String, String> nestedMap = centralEntry.getValue();
        for (Map.Entry<String, String> nestedEntry : nestedMap.entrySet()) {
            String nestedKey = nestedEntry.getKey();
            String value = nestedEntry.getValue();
            Entry<String, String> entry = new AbstractMap.SimpleEntry<>(centralKey + "-" + nestedKey, value);
            entries.add(entry);
        }
    }
    return entries.iterator();
}

public void removeElement(String centralKey, String nestedKey) {
    centralMap.get(centralKey).remove(nestedKey);
}
<<<explanation>>>: To iterate through a 2D map, you can use nested loops. In the iterator() method, you iterate through the centralMap and nestedMap to get the keys and values of each element. You create an Entry object with the combined keys and value, and add it to a list. Finally, you return the iterator of the list.

To remove an element through the iterator, you can create a separate method like removeElement(). In this method, you can use the centralMap to get the nestedMap for the given centralKey, and then remove the element with the nestedKey from the nestedMap.
